xxl.core.io.fat
Class DIR

java.lang.Object
  xxl.core.io.fat.DIR

public class DIR
extends Object

This class represents a directory for the FAT. One directory entry consist of 32 bytes. The order of numbers is little endian.

Nested Class Summary
protected  class DIR.ClusterTuple
          This class contains information about a number of a cluster.
protected  class DIR.DirectoryStructure
          Inner class represents one entry of the directory.
protected  class DIR.FreeInformation
          This class contains the information about one or more free directory entries.

Constant Field Values

ATTR_VOLUME_ID

public static final byte ATTR_VOLUME_ID
There should only be one "file" on the volume that has this attribute set, and that file must be in the root directory. This name of this file is actually the label for the volume. firstClusterHI and firstClusterLO must always be 0 for the volume label (no data clusters are allocated to the volume label file).

See Also:
Constant Field Values

ATTR_DIRECTORY

public static final byte ATTR_DIRECTORY
Indicates that this file is actually a container for other files.

See Also:
Constant Field Values

ATTR_ARCHIVE

public static final byte ATTR_ARCHIVE
This attribute supports backup utilities. This bit is set by the FAT file system driver when a file is created, renamed, or written to. Backup utilities may use this attribute to indicate which files on the volume have been modified since the last time that a backup was performed.

See Also:
Constant Field Values

illicitValues

public static final HashSet illicitValues
The name of a directory entry has some restrictions. This set contains characters that are not allowed to be in a short name.

           BPB bpb)

           BPB bpb,

Method Detail

getDir

protected byte[] getDir(long rootDirSectors,
                        long firstRootDirSecNum)
Return a byte array of the directory. Use this method only if you format your file-system. In case of FAT12 or FAT16 the returned byte array consists of enough sectors to store the BPB.RootEntCnt. In case of FAT32 the returned byte array is as big as a cluster.

Parameters:
rootDirSectors - the number of the sectors of the root directory.
firstRootDirSecNum - the cluster number stored at the root directory entry. In case of FAT12 or fAT16 this value should be 0. In case of FAT32 this value must be cluster number where the root directory is stored.
Returns:
the root directory as a byte array.

Parameters:
clusterNumber - the number of the cluster.
Returns:
the cluster as byte array.

createFile

public long createFile(String directoryName)
                throws DirectoryException
Create a new entry in the directory. In case the directory structure to the new entry doesn't exist a FileDoesntExist exception will be thrown. In case there is already an entry with the same name a NameAllreadyExists exception will be thrown. In case there is not enough memory to store the entry a NotEnoughMemory exception is thrown.

Parameters:
directoryName - is the name of the new file.
Returns:
the cluster number stored at the new entry.
Throws:
DirectoryException - in case the entry couldn't be created.

createFile

public long createFile(String directoryName,
                       long fileSize)
                throws DirectoryException
Create a new entry in the directory. The following values are initialized to the new entry: The name is the last component of directoryName, attribute, and fileSize. There will be enough space ordered to suffice the given size of the file. In case the directory structure to the new entry doesn't exist a FileDoesntExist exception will be thrown. In case there is already an entry with the same name a NameAllreadyExists exception will be thrown. In case there is not enough memory to store the entry or to suffice the given size of the file a NotEnoughMemory exception is thrown.

Parameters:
directoryName - is the name of the new file.
fileSize - is the size of the file of the new entry.
Returns:
the cluster number stored at the new entry.
Throws:
DirectoryException - in case the entry couldn't be created.

createFile

public long createFile(String directoryName,
                       byte attribute,
                       long fileSize)
                throws DirectoryException
Create a new entry in the directory. The following values are initialized to the new entry: The name is the last component of directoryName, attribute, and fileSize. There will be enough space ordered to suffice the given size of the file. In case the directory structure to the new entry doesn't exist a FileDoesntExist exception will be thrown. In case there is already an entry with the same name a NameAllreadyExists exception will be thrown. In case there is not enough memory to store the entry or to suffice the given size of the file a NotEnoughMemory exception is thrown.

Parameters:
directoryName - is the name of the new file.
attribute - is the attribute of the new entry.
fileSize - is the size of the file of the new entry.
Returns:
the cluster number stored at the new entry.
Throws:
DirectoryException - in case the entry couldn't be created.

findDirectoryEntry

public DirectoryEntryInformation findDirectoryEntry(String directoryName)

Returns:

findDirectoryEntry

protected DirectoryEntryInformation findDirectoryEntry(long clusterNumber,
                                                       String fileName,
                                                       boolean isRoot)
Find the directory entry with the given fileName in the cluster chain started at the given cluster number.

Parameters:
clusterNumber - the first cluster number of the cluster chain the entry should be searched. In case the clusterNumber belongs to the root directory only by FAT12 and FAT16 it has to be direct otherwise indirect.
fileName - the name of the file without the path or device name.
isRoot - indicates if the cluster number belongs to the root directory.
Returns:
information about the searched directory entry and the entry itself or null in case the searched entry doesn't exist.

createDirectory

public void createDirectory(String directoryName)
                     throws DirectoryException
Create a new directory (folder). One cluster is allocated to the directory (unless it is the root directory on a FAT16/FAT12 volume). All bytes in that cluster are initialized to 0. There are two special entries in the first two 32-byte directory entries of the directory (the first two 32 bytes entries in the data region of the cluster that is allocated). The first entry is the dot entry, the second entry is the dot dot entry. The dot entry points to itself and the dot dot entry points to the starting cluster of the parent of this directory.

Parameters:
directoryName - the name of the directory.
Throws:
DirectoryException - in case the directory couldn't be created.

createDirectory

public void createDirectory(String directoryName,
                            byte attributes)
                     throws DirectoryException
Create a new directory (folder). One cluster is allocated to the directory (unless it is the root directory on a FAT16/FAT12 volume). All bytes in that cluster are initialized to 0. There are two special entries in the first two 32-byte directory entries of the directory (the first two 32 bytes entries in the data region of the cluster that is allocated). The first entry is the dot entry, the second entry is the dot dot entry. The dot entry points to itself and the dot dot entry points to the starting cluster of the parent of this directory.

Parameters:
directoryName - the name of the directory.
attributes - the attributes for the new entry.
Throws:
DirectoryException - in case the directory couldn't be created.

containsIllicitValues

public static boolean containsIllicitValues(byte[] name)
Return true if the byte array contains illegal values. That are all values smaller than 0x20 except 0x05 and also all values that are in the illicit-set.

Parameters:
name - the name.
Returns:
true if the byte array contains an illegal value otherwise false.

recreateFileName

public static String recreateFileName(byte[] buffer,
                                      int from,
                                      int to)
Return the recreated file name from a string stored as a directoryEntry. This method will always create a dot in the returned string so don't use this method with files that have the directory attribute set. The dot and dot dot strings will be returned without blanks at the end.

Parameters:
buffer - holds the information of the file name.
from - the start index inclusive.
to - the end index exclusive.
Returns:
the file name in 8.3 naming convention.

getLastWriteTime

public long getLastWriteTime(String fileName)
Return the last write time stored at the directory entry given by the fileName. The returned value is the number of milliseconds since January 1, 1970, 00:00:00 GMT.

Parameters:
fileName - the name of the file.
Returns:
the number of milliseconds since January 1, 1970, 00:00:00 GMT until the last write time.

Parameters:

Returns:
the number of milliseconds since January 1, 1970, 00:00:00 GMT, until the creation time.

Parameters:
fileName - the given filename
Returns:
true if and only if the file or directory is successfully deleted; false otherwise.

Return true if the file associated with the given file name is read only. If no such file exists true is returned.

Parameters:
fileName - the name of the file.
Returns:
true if the file is marked as read only or if the file doesn't exist.

setLastWriteTime

protected boolean setLastWriteTime(String fileName,
                                   long time)
Set the last write time of the directory entry given by fileName.

Parameters:
fileName - the name of the file.
time - is the last write time in milliseconds since January 1, 1970, 00:00:00 GMT.
Returns:
true if the last write time could be set otherwise false.

protected boolean setLastWriteDate(String fileName,
                                   int year,
                                   int month,
                                   int day)

year - the year of the last write date.
month - the month of the last write date.
day - the day of the last write date.
Returns:
true if the last date could be set; false otherwise.

                              long fileLength)
Update the length of the file associated by the given file name.

fileLength - the new length.
Returns:
true in case the length could be set; false otherwise.

list

public String[] list(String fileName)
Returns an array of strings naming the files and directories in the directory denoted by this fileName. If this fileName does not denote a directory, then this method returns null. Otherwise an array of strings is returned, one for each file or directory in the directory. Names denoting the directory itself and the directory's parent directory are not included in the result. Each string is a file name rather than a complete path. There is no guarantee that the name strings in the resulting array will appear in any specific order; they are not, in particular, guaranteed to appear in alphabetical order.

Parameters:
fileName - the given filename
Returns:
An array of strings naming the files and directories in the directory denoted by this fileName. The array will be empty if the directory is empty. Returns null if this fileName does not denote a directory, or if an I/O error occurs.

listRoots

public String[] listRoots()
List the files of the root directory.

Returns:
an array of strings denoting the files and directories of the root directory or an empty array in case there is no entry in the root directory.

numericTailGeneration

protected String numericTailGeneration(String longName,
                                       Iterator clusterIterator)
Return a short name made of the given long name for the directory that is associated with the given cluster number. In case there are more than one short names in a directory that equals each other they get a numeric tail in order to distinguish them. Of course this is only possible if the long names for this short names are not equal to each other. In case the short name is unique for this directory and the longname fits the 8.3 naming convention (except the upper case rule) there will be no numeric tail generated.

Parameters:
longName - the long name.
clusterIterator - iterator that iterates over the cluster chain where the the given longName is stored.
Returns:
the unique short name of the given long name for the directory given by clusterIterator.

getBasisName

public static String getBasisName(String longName)
Create the short name (8.3 name) from a given long name.

Parameters:
longName - the name of a file or directory for which the 8.3 naming convention doesn't hold.
Returns:
the basis name of the given longName.

convertToOEM

public static String convertToOEM(String str)
Converts the given string to OEM. All characters that are not allowed to be in a short name are replaced by an underscore '_'.

Parameters:
str - the String to convert.
Returns:
the converted String.

checksum

public static short checksum(byte[] name)
Returns the checksum of the given name. The checksum is stored in long directory entries. The name must have a length of 11 and it must be in the format of a MS-DOS directory entry. See the paper: "Hardware White Paper. Microsoft Extensible Firmware Initiative FAT32 File System specification. Version 1.03 DEcember 6, 2000" for more details.

Parameters:
name - assumed to be 11 bytes long.
Returns:
the checksum.

                                   boolean isRoot)
Check if the directory given by clusterNumber is empty.

Parameters:
clusterNumber - the number of the cluster.
isRoot - indicates if the clusterNumber belongs to the root directory.
Returns:
return true if the directory is empty; false otherwise.

                                    int year,
                                    int month,
                                    int day)

day - the last write day, valid range from 1 to 31.

getEntries

public EntriesFilterIterator getEntries(int listEntryAttribute)
Return an iterator which lists all entries of the directory structure depending on the given list entry attribute. The iterator will return DirectoryEntryInformation objects, which contains all important information.

Parameters:
listEntryAttribute - specifies the kind of entries that should be returned within the iterator.
Returns:
Iterator which returns 32 byte arrays.
See Also:
DirectoryEntryInformation
